greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of deco polyominoes of height n having along the lower contour exactly k reentrant corners, i.e., a vertical step that is followed by a horizontal step (n>=1, k>=0).
comment: A deco polyomino is a directed column-convex polyomino in which the height, measured along the diagonal, is attained only in the last column.
link: E. Barcucci, A. Del Lungo and R. Pinzani, "Deco" polyominoes, permutations and random generation, Theoretical Computer Science, 159, 1996, 29-42.
formula: The row generating polynomials are P(n,t) = Q(n,t,1), where Q(1,t,x) = 1 and Q(n,t,x) = Q(n-1,t,t) + (n-1)xQ(n-1,t,1) for n >= 2.
example: T(2,0)=2 because the deco polyominoes of height 2 are the vertical and horizontal dominoes, having no reentrant corners along the lower contour.
maple: Q[1]:=1: for n from 2 to 13 do Q[n]:=sort(expand(subs(x=t,Q[n-1])+(n-1)*x*subs(x=1,Q[n-1]))) od: for n from 1 to 13 do P[n]:=subs(x=1,Q[n]) od: for n from 1 to 13 do seq(coeff(P[n],t,j),j=0..ceil(n/2)-1) od; # yields sequence in triangular form
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Aug 08 2006
